Others: Zach Edey got off to a sedate start against the Washington Wizards at the FedEx Forum on Friday (Nov. 8).
Edey entered Friday's game with 8:15 left in the first quarter.
At the time of this writing, he had logged 10:59 minutes.
Zach Edey contributed with 14 points, 8 rebounds, and 2 assists and a three-pointer on 5-of-8 shooting as Memphis 128-104 celebrated back-to-back victories.
Edey was replaced by Brandon Clarke in the starting lineup.
Despite the Grizzlies' comfortable win, the game was packed with intensity, especially in the third quarter when Edey and Valanciunas battled under the basket for a critical rebound.
Tensions flared, and Edey, clearly unamused, nudged Valanciunas, prompting officials to step in.
The Grizzlies and Ja Morant have plenty of work left this season to cement themselves with the elite in the West.
